Author: Kyi_ophelia862

Comment Text:
Oh don’t be fooled that the problem lies only with Russia and China. Have a look at the veto records of the Security Council. The US has been very willing to veto anything in reference to its allies, like Saudi Arabia and Israel, or anything that involves its actions.

Again, everyone doesn’t understand that the UN is not the world government or police. It is not the global equivalent of the EU. It is merely an intergovernmental organisation that happen to be handed many many responsiblilities. 

The P5 are handed veto power in the UNSC to encourage that they remain on the table. 

For UN to send peacekeepers into Myanmar, not only does the UNSC has to authorise it, but all parties in the conflict (that is the junta, all ethnic armed groups, and NLD/CRPH) has to also agree to it. 

The alternative is that the UNSC authorises full military intervention, which is unlikely. Because hardly anyone wants to risk troops to get in between what is now a brewing civil war.

Any military intervention at this stage will only make Myanmar’s future worse. Until a viable solution post-intervention can be achieved, we risk making Myanmar becoming Syria/Iraq. It pains me to say this, but the bigger picture is accepting that for a better future, accepting some will loss their life today is the unfortunate part of it.
